author: @xom33mzy
text: i need help with my kivy its giving me error  raise Exception('Invalid instance in App.root')  Exception: Invalid instance in App.root    import kivy from kivy.app import App from kivy.uix.label import Label from kivy.uix.gridlayout import GridLayout from kivy.uix.textinput import TextInput from kivy.uix.button import Button kivy.require("1.10.1")   class ConnectPage(GridLayout):     def __init__(self,**kwargs):         super(ConnectPage, self).__init__(**kwargs)         self.cols=1          self.add_widget(Label(text="text editor david landman"))         self.ip=TextInput(multiline=False)         self.add_widget(self.ip)         self.join=Button(text="join")         self.join.bind(on_press=self.join_button)           self.add_widget(self.join)     def join_button(self,instance):         port=self.port.text         ip=self.ip.text         username=self.username.text         print(f"attempting to join{ip}:{port} as {username}")   class ConnectPage(App):     def build(self):         return ConnectPage()   if __name__=="__main__":     ConnectPage().run()         by the way im using pycharm i need help on this i dident want to add all the text boxes,

author: @jeetchugh3508
text: For anyone who is following along, but wants to use the .kv language, this is what I have so far:  Code (.py):  import kivy from kivy.app import App from kivy.uix.label import Label from kivy.uix.gridlayout import GridLayout from kivy.uix.textinput import TextInput from kivy.uix.button import Button from kivy.properties import StringProperty import os  class ChatBot(GridLayout):      prev_ip = StringProperty('IP')     prev_port = StringProperty('Port')     prev_username = StringProperty('Username')      def __init__(self, **kwargs):         super().__init__(**kwargs)          if os.path.isfile("prev_details.txt"):             with open('prev_details.txt', 'r') as f:                 d = f.read().split(',')                 self.prev_ip = d[0]                 self.prev_port = d[1]                 self.prev_username = d[2]         else:             self.prev_ip = ''             self.prev_port = ''             self.prev_username = ''       def join_button(self):         print('Attempting to join {ip}:{port} as {user}'.format(             ip=self.ip.text,port=self.port.text,user=self.username.text))          with open("prev_details.txt", "w") as f:             f.write("{a},{b},{c}".format(                 a=self.ip.text,b=self.port.text,c=self.username.text))  class ChatApp(App):     def build(self):         return ChatBot()  if __name__ == '__main__':     ChatApp().run()  (.kv CODE):  <ChatBot>:      ip: IP     port: PORT     username: USERNAME      GridLayout:          cols: 2         size: root.width,root.height          Label:             text: 'IP:'         TextInput:             multiline: False             text: root.prev_ip             id: IP          Label:             text: 'Port:'         TextInput:             multiline: False             text: root.prev_port             id: PORT          Label:             text: 'Username:'         TextInput:             multiline: False             text: root.prev_username             id: USERNAME          Label:         Button:             text: 'Join'             id: JOIN_button             on_press: root.join_button()

text: More pythonic way for loading preferences: import errno  try:     with open("prev_details.txt") as f:             d = f.read().split()             ... except IOError as e:     if e.errno != errno.ENOENT:         raise     prev_pi = ""    ...

author: @slavoie
text: Superb as always! Cheers! I personally like very much unpacking variables on the fly, so at 7:55, you could have something like: prev_ip, prev_port, prev_username = f.read().split(",") It's just splitting the list right into variables while unpacking. I know you know, but for those who didn't, now you do! ;)
